strings.string: Squid Cache cleared for all URLs applied to "%1$s" (Id: #%2$s).
Enter the Host Names separated by newlines, to be used in the command "squidclient -h hostname -m PURGE $url".
Squid cache will be cleared for all URLs applied to this asset.
Note: You may modify the Squid Cache settings in the External Tools Configuration.
Additonal options to be included in the purge command.
PURGE command should also clear selected URLs with appended trailing slash.
Request each URL after the purge action so that Squid can recache it.
Clear the cache of the selected asset and its children.
Note: Repopulate and Cascade option will also be applied to the cron job if you schedule one.

You can specify a port to add to each URL when submitted to Squid. If you are running Squiz Matrix on a non-standard port behind Squid, you may need to add the port back to the URL to clear the cache.
Please make sure there is at least one hostname in the Squid Cache section of External Tools Configuration.
Please make sure you set the path to squidclient in the Squid Cache section of External Tools Configuration.
The squidclient path is invalid. Please check it in the Squid Cache section of External Tools Configuration.
